title: Villa Somalia
text:
Villa Somalia (, ) is a building in <a href="Mogadishu">Mogadishu</a>, the capital of <a href="Somalia">Somalia</a>. It serves as the <a href="official%20residence">official residential</a> <a href="presidential%20palace">palace</a> and principal workplace of the <a href="List%20of%20Presidents%20of%20Somalia">President of Somalia</a>.
History.
The edifice was built in the <a href="Art%20Deco">Art Deco</a> style by the colonial authorities in <a href="Italian%20Somaliland">Italian Somaliland</a>, serving as a residence for the Governors.
Villa Somalia (originally called "Villa del Viceré" when inaugurated in October 1936) was on high ground that overlooked <a href="Mogadishu%20under%20Italian%20rule">Italian Mogadishu</a> on the <a href="Indian%20Ocean">Indian Ocean</a>, with access to both the <a href="Port%20of%20Mogadishu">harbour</a> and <a href="Aden%20Adde%20International%20Airport">Petrella airport</a>. It was originally a large, squarish <a href="stucco">stucco</a> building with a tiled roof.
The edifice was built in the new section of the city (developed by the Italians in the late 1930s) and it was a famous symbol of modernist (art deco) architecture.
Following independence in 1960, the building became the presidential palace of the President of the <a href="Somali%20Republic">Somali Republic</a>. After the start of the <a href="Somali%20Civil%20War">civil war</a> and the overthrow of the <a href="Siad%20Barre">Siad Barre</a> administration in the early 1990s, various local faction leaders fought for control of and installed themselves in the residence. 
On 8 January 2007, <a href="Transitional%20Federal%20Government">Transitional Federal Government</a> President <a href="Abdullahi%20Yusuf%20Ahmed">Abdullahi Yusuf Ahmed</a> entered Mogadishu for the first time since being elected to office. The government subsequently relocated to Villa Somalia from its interim location at <a href="Baidoa">Baidoa</a>.
Today, it is the office of the President of Somalia <a href="Mohamed%20Abdullahi%20Mohamed">Mohamed Abdullahi Mohamed</a>.
Chief of Staff.
<a href="Mohamed%20Abdullahi%20Mohamed">Mohamed</a> appointed Fahad Yasin to the position of <a href="Chief%20of%20staff">Chief of Staff</a> for Villa Somalia in April 2017.
On 8 September 2021 Mohamed appointed <a href="Abdisaid%20Muse%20Ali">Abdisaid Muse Ali</a> as <a href="Chief%20of%20staff">Chief of Staff</a> for Villa Somalia, previously he was National Security Advisor to the President.
